isis.stitle: FRONT STEER AXLE: EATON EFA-12 - REPLACE - ACKERMANN OR STEERING ARM REPLACEMENT

step1.para: Disconnect tie rod end from Ackermann Arm (or drag link from steering arm).
Remove cotter pin and nut from arm at knuckle end.
Drive arm out of knuckle using suitable brass drift and hammer.

note.para: Do not use heat on components to facilitate removal of arms.

step1.para: Install new key in slot provided in Ackermann Arm (or steering arm).
Install nut and tighten to 350 - 490 ft-lbs. (475 - 664 N·m)* ( Figure 28). Install cotter pin.
*Tighten to minimum, then continue tightening to align cotter pin hole. Verify that torque does not exceed maximum. If it does, replace nut.
Reconnect tie rod ends. Install nut and tighten to 165 - 230 ft-lbs. (224 - 312 N·m)* ( Figure 28). Install cotter pin.
*Tighten to minimum, then continue tightening to align cotter pin hole. Verify that torque does not exceed maximum. If it does, replace nut.
